column4: wols_-> for temporary things is not stupid..but then again i jumped into a convo , i didnt have prior knowledge
wols_-> you seem perturbed this morning..may i offer you a cup of joe? calms the nerves..hehe
Leefmc-> come on man, all the ops deserves one of those days...with people asking questions here like..hehe..
Threethan-> okay, your w850g can alllow other clients?
Threethan-> does it have a dmz option? or allow nat and forwarding on that router
wols_-> me? i dont have a problem..another user perhaps?
Threethan-> can you describe again your network layout?  things went scrolling fast,
Err... It goes from the DSL line to the modem to the router, to my computer (wired) my sister's computer (wired) and my wife's computer (wireless)
How would I find out if it has a dmz option or if it allows nat and forwarding?
I'm looking at that right now. I just don't know where in the manual it'd be. Under what topic.
It has a dmz ip address configuration option. So, I assume it does have a dmz option.
Yes, the windows host can access it. The ubuntu host, which is the same computer (dual booting) cannot.
And, yes, it does allow forwarding.
Tried that, it's going too fast for me to review it. ifconfig | more is the same way.
Everytime, it goes too fast for me to look at it. I try the pause|break key, but that doesn't help either.
